item.title: Metal Gear Survive Final Review - The Soul of the Series Is MIA
item.description: Despite losing the soul of the series, there's fun in Survive's resource-gathering base-building loop and co-op action.
item.content:encoded:
Metal Gear Survive is a weird game. In its sometimes clumsy efforts to merge stealth action, base-building, survival sim, and horror by stitching together pieces from past Metal Gear games, it’s effectively scrubbed those elements of the series’ signature humor and personality. That uniquely wild mix of sharp socio-political commentary and zany military sci-fi that has defined Metal Gear is swapped out in favor of a subpar fantasy plot involving zombies and wormholes, delivered by a cast of underdeveloped characters.

But there is fun to be had in Survive’s mishmash of ideas and the repetitive, yet comforting loop of resource-gathering and base-building, if you’re willing to power through many hours of initial tedium.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Chloi Rad

item.title: How to Unlock Street Fighter's Ryu in Monster Hunter World

item.title: Rust Review - A Unique Combination of Survival
item.description: A survival game that combines many elements in interesting ways without ever mastering any of them.
item.content:encoded:
Rust is a griefer’s paradise. There’s nothing quite like finding a guy sleeping in a forest and looting him before he wakes up, or camping outside another player’s fort and killing her when she opens the door. For those who enjoy deadly games of cat and mouse, Rust might just be the best survival game out there. But anybody more interested in building and exploration, or isn’t able to devote themselves to one game, may have a rough time.

Even though other games are better at specific elements like crafting, combat, survival, and exploration, I’ve never played a survival game that combines them quite like Rust. The way it blends survival and competitive genres is fun, especially if you enjoy the goofier bits, like firing rocket launchers at a naked man running from a pig, or being stabbed to death by a person blasting Russian music over their microphone and brandishing a spear. It’s weirder and less polished than the competition, but that’s part of the fun.

Continue reading…

item.title: Mario Odyssey's Balloon World Update, Payday 2 for Switch, Zelda Sales, and Sonic Movie Details - Nintendo Voice Chat Ep. 396
item.description: IGN's weekly Nintendo show tackles the latest releases, Mario Odyssey's Balloon World update, Payday 2 for Switch, Zelda sales, and new Sonic Movie Details!
item.content:encoded:
Weeelcooome to episode 396 of our weekly Nintendo show and podcast, Nintendo Voice Chat. This week, Lily Zaldivar and Miranda Sanchez join the panel to discuss the new Super Mario Odyssey's Balloon World Update, Zelda sales in Japan, Payday 2 for Switch, and more!

As always, you can watch NVC here on IGN and on our YouTube channel (subscribe and hit that bell! It gives fairies wings!) or listen to it on your commute in audio format. If you enjoy the show, share it with other Nintendo fans, leave us a comment, and give us a thumbs up or leave us a review! If you prefer audio over video, please subscribe to NVC on iTunes or your podcast service of choice. You can also download and listen to the Latest Episode of NVC Right Here.

As always, watch out for spoilers!

That’s pretty much everything we spotted in Black Panther. Did we miss any Easter eggs or references? Let us know in the comments.

item.dc:creator: Scott Collura

item.title: Walking Dead Characters Ranked By How Much We Care
item.description: If Daryl dies, would we still riot? Here's a look - ahead of Sunday's midseason premiere - at who we still care about on The Walking Dead.
item.content:encoded:
Warning: Spoilers follow for AMC's The Walking Dead through Season 8's midseason finale, "How It's Gotta Be."

Even with the multitude of characters it's killed off over the years - the mounds and mountains of bodies that have piled up - The Walking Dead still has the largest ensemble on TV. As we head into Season 8's midseason premiere, "Honor" - airing Sunday, February 25th - the show still has two dozen names and faces to juggle. And our feelings about most of them, a solid 75 percent of them, range from intolerance to indifference.

With only a few appealing apocalyptic warriors to choose from, we've decided, ahead of the midseason premiere, to rank all of the current core cast members of The Walking Dead with regards to - well - how much we give a s*** about them. Who do we actually care about now, eight seasons in? Who will we be sad to see go when their time comes? Is there still anyone worth "rioting" over?

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Matt Fowler

item.title: Rise of the Tomb Raider Coming to Xbox Game Pass
item.description: It's one of eight games teased for the subscription service next month.
item.content:encoded:
Next month will see Rise of the Tomb Raider becoming part of Xbox Game Pass.

Microsoft's Larry "Major Nelson" Hryb teased in a tweet that Rise of the Tomb Raider will be available to Xbox Game Pass subscribers in March. It was one of eight games shown in a photo (seen below), though the other seven were obscured.

Microsoft's Larry Hryb tweeted out this photo that shows Rise of the Tomb Raider coming to Xbox Game Pass in March. The seven other games are hidden, but it's presumed at least one of them is Sea of Thieves.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Michael Domanico

item.title: The Room's Tommy Wiseau, Greg Sestero Reunite for New Film
item.description: The film follows Wiseau and Sestero hatching an underground enterprise.
item.content:encoded:
The Room's Tommy Wiseau and Greg Sestero are returning to theaters soon with the two-volume road trip adventure, Best F(r)iends.

The film, written by Sestero, is coming to nearly 600 U.S. theaters for four nights only, with the first volume playing on March 30 and April 2, followed by the second volume on June 1 and 4. All four screenings will be played at 8pm PT/ET. Watch the trailer below:

The story is inspired by a real-life road trip Wiseau and Sestero took after the production of The Room in April 2003. It follows Sestero playing a drifter who is taken in by Wiseau's mortician. The duo hatch an underground enterprise, but their plans unravel due to greed, hatred and jealousy.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: A Cheetos Movie Is in the Works
item.description: The film will tell the true story of Richard Montanez, who came up with the idea for Flamin’ Hot Cheetos.
item.content:encoded:
A movie about the creator of Flamin' Hot Cheetos is in development.

Variety reports Fox Searchlight and DeVon Franklin are producing Flamin' Hot, a film about Richard Montanez, the man who came up with the billion-dollar idea for Flamin' Hot Cheetos. Lewis Colick (Ladder 49) is writing the script. A release date has not been set yet and no director is attached.

Flamin’ Hot Cheetos.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: Dragon Ball FighterZ Getting Patches to Fix Online Problems
item.description: Arc System Works has promised to fix the online problems, such as matchmaking, by next month.
item.content:encoded:
Dragon Ball FighterZ has been suffering from numerous online issues since launch, but developer Arc System Works has promised it's working to fix the problems.

In a recent video, producer Tomoko Hiroki announced two patches will be coming out soon intended to resolve issues like matchmaking. The first patch will be released before the end of February.

"We've heard all of your feedback since the release, and we're fully aware of the online issues that you're having, such as the matching in Ring Match or being disconnected from the lobby," Hiroki said. "We're aware of the situation, and keen to resolve them with all our might."

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: PSA: Udemy Sale on Game Design, Programming, Japanese and More Back On
item.description: Snuggle up with your computer and wake up on Monday with some newfound knowledge.
item.content:encoded:
If you buy something through this post, IGN may get a share of the sale. For more, read our Terms of Use.

Whatever plans you have for this weekend, cancel them immediately, because Udemy is running another sale on game development courses. OK, that might be a little extreme, so maybe you could enhance your weekend plans by sitting down and learning how to code, build a website, or even start learning Japanese? Udemy is having a sale on its courses right now, so you can grab some on the cheap and start learning a skill to improve your life in countless ways.
